name: Paneer Naan
history: Paneer Naan is a variation of the traditional Indian naan bread, incorporating paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into the dough. It's a fusion of classic naan and the rich flavors of paneer, offering a delicious twist to the conventional Indian bread.
description: Paneer Naan is a soft and fluffy Indian bread stuffed with spiced paneer filling. Made by combining naan dough with a flavorful paneer mixture, it's typically cooked in a tandoor or oven and often served with Indian curries or as a snack.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For preparing the dough and filling.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. Add yogurt and warm water to form a soft dough. Knead well, then cover and let it rise for about 2 hours.

instructions.title: Make Paneer Filling
instructions.description: Mix crumbled paneer with garam masala, cumin powder, chopped coriander, and green chilies. Set aside.

instructions.title: Assemble the Naan
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll out each ball, place a portion of the paneer filling in the center, and seal it by bringing the edges together. Gently roll out again to flatten.

instructions.title: Cook the Naan
instructions.description: Preheat the oven or tandoor. Place the naan on a baking tray or tandoor surface. Cook until puffed up and golden brown, turning once.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Brush the cooked naan with oil or ghee. Serve hot with Indian curries or dips.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
Adjust the spiciness of the filling according to your preference.
variations: Add finely chopped onions or capsicum to the paneer filling for extra crunch.
Experiment with different herbs like mint or dill for varied flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored for 1 day.
storage.instructions: Wrap in foil and store in the refrigerator. Reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in an oven or on a pan until warm.
presentationTips: Cut into wedges and serve on a platter with a side of chutney.
Garnish with a sprinkle of chaat masala or freshly chopped coriander.
